titleStmt.title: The boasting Baptist dismounted, and the Beast disarmed and sorely wounded without any carnal weapon. In a reply to some papers, written by Jonathan Iohnson, of Lincolne, as an answer to a letter, sent him by Martin Mason, concerning some exceptions against several truths. / Published by a faithfull minister, not of the letter, but of the everlasting Gospel.
titleStmt.author: Mason, Martin, fl. 1650-1676.

titleStmt.title: The boasting Baptist dismounted, and the Beast disarmed and sorely wounded without any carnal weapon. In a reply to some papers, written by Jonathan Iohnson, of Lincolne, as an answer to a letter, sent him by Martin Mason, concerning some exceptions against several truths. / Published by a faithfull minister, not of the letter, but of the everlasting Gospel.
titleStmt.author: Mason, Martin, fl. 1650-1676.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Giles Calvert, and are to be sold at the Black-spread-Eagle neer the west-end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: A reply to an untraced work by Jonathan Johnson.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
